_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five weaknesses when you're training: Using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence
The four right efforts [an9.73:2.7]: Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that bad, unskillful qualities donâ€™t arise
Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen are given up
Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that skillful qualities arise

Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are completed by development.
